issue.title: Remove assertions that operate on class/object properties

labels.name: feature/assertion
labels.description: Issues related to assertions and expectations

issue.body:
The following methods of `PHPUnit\Framework\Assert` will be removed in PHPUnit 11:

* `assertClassHasAttribute()`
* `assertClassNotHasAttribute()`
* `assertClassHasStaticAttribute()`
* `assertClassNotHasStaticAttribute()`
* `assertObjectHasAttribute()`
* `assertObjectNotHasAttribute()`
* `classHasAttribute()`
* `classHasStaticAttribute()`
* `objectHasAttribute()`

The following classes will be removed in PHPUnit 11:

* `PHPUnit\Framework\Constraint\ClassHasAttribute`
* `PHPUnit\Framework\Constraint\ClassHasStaticAttribute`
* `PHPUnit\Framework\Constraint\ObjectHasAttribute`

This follows #4601.

body:
Checked a (private) code base of mine and found a few uses of `assertObjectHasAttribute` and `assertObjectNotHasAttribute`

The use-case is when having to work with `stdClass` (e.g. from JSON deserialization) and there's no notion of what the actual shape is.
â€¦Â and indeed, replacing/removing them was a no-brainer ðŸ˜„

rename.from: Deprecate assertions that operate on class/object properties

issue.title: Add PropertyExistsWithoutAssertRector
issue.body: Removes the [now deprecated](https://github.com/sebastianbergmann/phpunit/issues/4601) property/method exists PHPUnit assertions and replaces them with plain PHP equivalents. This is the inverse of [AssertPropertyExistsRector.php](https://github.com/rectorphp/rector-phpunit/blob/ee461b14551189faca960058ef4fb1146755f8ca/src/Rector/MethodCall/AssertPropertyExistsRector.php) to account for their removal in PHPUnit v10.

issue.title: assertObjectHasAttribute deprecated

repository.name: acquia-php-sdk-v2
repository.description: A PHP SDK for Acquia Cloud API v2 https://cloud.acquia.com/api-docs/#

issue.body:
PHPUnit deprecated assertObjectHasAttribute, arguing that any test that relies on it is of dubious value: https://github.com/sebastianbergmann/phpunit/issues/4601

I tend to agree, these tests feel a little pointless to me. They're basically testing that a Response class has certain properties on it, which can never not be true unless we intentionally change the class.

@typhonius are you okay with this general approach? We use this pattern in dozens, possibly hundreds of tests. I want to be sure before I go fixing them all.

Edit: Ugh. It looks like mutation tests may indeed fail if we don't explicitly test the return types.

issue.title: assertObjectHasAttribute is deprecated + being removed in PHPUnit 10

labels.name: Group 9 - Automated Testing

repository.name: tripal
repository.description: The Tripal package is  a suite of Drupal modules for creating biological (genomic, genetic, breeding) websites. Visit the Tripal homepage at http://tripal.info for documentation, support, and other information.  The Drupal project page is at http://drupal.org/project/tripal.

issue.body:
# Core Tripal 4 Development Task

## Pull #1441

PHPUnit has deprecated the use of assertObjectHasAttribute() and an number of other assertions that operate on class/object properties as described here: https://github.com/sebastianbergmann/phpunit/issues/4601

There are no planned replacements:
> At this time, no replacements are planned as these assertions are not wildly used (to the best of my knowledge) and, if at all, should only be used in edge case situations that I consider outside the scope of PHPUnit's standard distribution.

One way to fix this is the following:

``` diff
-        $this->assertObjectHasAttribute('c', $sut->a->b);
+        $this->assertIsObject($sut->a->b);
+        $this->assertTrue(property_exists($sut->a->b, 'c'));
```

These are found in the following places:

- tripal_chado/tests/src/Functional/api/ChadoCvAPITest.php:59

- tripal_chado/tests/src/Functional/api/ChadoCvAPITest.php:67
- tripal_chado/tests/src/Functional/api/ChadoCvAPITest.php:125
- tripal_chado/tests/src/Functional/api/ChadoCvAPITest.php:134
- tripal_chado/tests/src/Functional/api/ChadoCvAPITest.php:160
- tripal_chado/tests/src/Functional/api/ChadoVariablesAPITest.php:116:
- tripal_chado/tests/src/Functional/api/ChadoVariablesAPITest.php:124
- tripal_chado/tests/src/Functional/api/ChadoDbAPITest.php:53
- tripal_chado/tests/src/Functional/api/ChadoDbAPITest.php:63
- tripal_chado/tests/src/Functional/api/ChadoDbAPITest.php:117
- tripal_chado/tests/src/Functional/api/ChadoDbAPITest.php:125
- tripal_chado/tests/src/Functional/api/ChadoDbAPITest.php:151

As of yet, no one is working on this so if you have time, assign this issue to yourself and start work on a branch named `tv4g9-issue1439-assertObjectHasAttribute`

body: Thank you mate, @sebastianbergmann , you made us extra nonsense work for fixing our test environment

> Thank you mate, @sebastianbergmann , you made us extra nonsense work for fixing our test environment

That's a bit harsh... especially when considering that:
1. you wouldn't be required to do any changes unless your test environment is on the bleeding edge
2. if you used the affected methods before, it means that they made sense to you at the time
3. refactoring code should be a breeze in a decent IDE - PhpStorm, for example, has special handling for deprecations
4. be grateful that the authors took the time to mark parts as deprecated before actual removal - many other projects do no such thing (you'd be lucky if they follow SemVer)

issue.title: Tv4g9 issue1439 assert object has attribute

repository.name: tripal
repository.description: The Tripal package is  a suite of Drupal modules for creating biological (genomic, genetic, breeding) websites. Visit the Tripal homepage at http://tripal.info for documentation, support, and other information.  The Drupal project page is at http://drupal.org/project/tripal.

issue.body:
# Core Tripal 4 Development Task
## Issue #1439 

<!--- Enter the Tripal version this PR applies to (i.e. either 3 or 4 ;-p) --->
### Tripal Version: 4.x alpha

## Description
PHPUnit has deprecated the use of ```assertObjectHasAttribute()``` and a number of other assertions that operate on class/object properties as described here: https://github.com/sebastianbergmann/phpunit/issues/4601

There was already a ```assertIsObject()``` for all of these cases, so we now do a ```assertIsTrue(property_exists($obj, 'key'))```

In addition to the changes listed by Lacey in the issue, there is one instance of ```assertObjectNotHasAttribute()``` that is updated.

## Testing?
Code review and automated testing should be adequate to test these changes.
